title-group.article-title: WRITING UNITS OF INTEGRAL GROUP RINGS OF FINITE ABELIAN GROUPS AS A PRODUCT OF BASS UNITS

abstract.p: We give a constructive proof of the theorem of Bass and Milnor saying that if G is a finite abelian group then the Bass units of the integral group ring ‚Ñ§G generate a subgroup of finite index in its unit group ùòú(‚Ñ§G). Our proof provides algorithms to represent some units that contribute to only one simple component of ‚ÑöG and generate a subgroup of finite index in ùòú(‚Ñ§G) as product of Bass units. We also obtain a basis B formed by Bass units of a free abelian subgroup of finite index in ùòú(‚Ñ§G) and give, for an arbitrary Bass unit b, an algorithm to express bùúë(|G|) as a product of a trivial unit and powers of at most two units in this basis B.
